title: INV-012 CAPA-1: Propagate CR-091 Interaction System to Production Submodule

comment:
QA Pre-Review of CR-092 v0.1 — RECOMMEND

FRONTMATTER VERIFICATION:
- title: "INV-012 CAPA-1: Propagate CR-091 Interaction System to Production Submodule" — present and non-empty
- revision_summary: "Initial draft" — acceptable for v0.1 executable document (self-authorizing per SOP-002 Section 8)

DOCUMENT STRUCTURE (per SOP-002 Section 6 / TEMPLATE-CR):
All 12 required sections present:
1. Purpose — present; identifies this as INV-012 CAPA-1 corrective action
2. Scope — present (2.1 Context with parent document reference, 2.2 Changes Summary, 2.3 Files Affected)
3. Current State — present; states submodule at 2c6b826 (CR-089 state)
4. Proposed State — present; states submodule at c83dda0 (CR-091 merge commit)
5. Change Description — present (5.1 Propagation Strategy, 5.2 Submodule Pointer Update, 5.3 RTM Verification)
6. Justification — present; three clear justification points
7. Impact Assessment — present (7.1 Files, 7.2 Documents, 7.3 Other Impacts)
8. Testing Summary — present (Automated Verification, Integration Verification)
9. Implementation Plan — present; six sequenced steps
10. Execution — present; EI table with 6 items, EI-5 flagged "Yes" for VR
11. Execution Summary — present with execution-phase placeholder
12. References — present; governing SOPs and parent documents referenced

Template Sections 7.4/7.5 (Development Controls / Qualified State Continuity): Correctly omitted. CR-092 does not write or modify code — it propagates existing commits and updates a submodule pointer. This is not a code modification CR.

PLACEHOLDER VERIFICATION:
- Draft-phase placeholders ({{...}}): None found. PASS
- Execution-phase placeholders ([...]): Present in Sections 10-11 as expected. PASS
- No TBD, TODO, FIXME, XXX found. PASS

TRACEABILITY TO PARENT INV:
- INV-012 CAPA-001 description: "Merge interaction system code to production qms-cli submodule, update submodule pointer in pipe-dream, and re-verify RTM qualified baseline"
- CR-092 addresses all three components: (1) Section 5.1 propagation strategy, (2) Section 5.2 submodule pointer update, (3) Section 5.3 RTM verification. VERIFIED.

VR COLUMN:
- EI-5 marked "Yes" for integration verification (command availability, commit reachability). Appropriate per SOP-004 Section 9C.3.

TECHNICAL ACCURACY:
- Commit hashes (2c6b826, c78198d, d820b05, 7e708fc, c83dda0) consistent with INV-012 findings. VERIFIED.
- Fast-forward push preserving commit hashes: technically correct. VERIFIED.

FORMATTING AND CONSISTENCY:
- Section numbering sequential (1-12). PASS
- Table formatting consistent. PASS
- No spelling or grammar errors found. PASS
- Markdown formatting consistent throughout. PASS

FINDING: COMPLIANT. Document meets all pre-review requirements. Recommend proceeding to pre-approval.

QA Post-Review of CR-092 v1.2 — RECOMMEND

POST-REVIEW CHECKLIST (per SOP-002 v14.0 Section 7.3):

1. EXECUTION COMPLETE:
All 6 EIs show Task Outcome: Pass. No Fail outcomes. No VARs required.
- EI-1: Pass — pre-execution baseline at a383747
- EI-2: Pass — origin already at c83dda0 (deviation documented: push unnecessary)
- EI-3: Pass — production submodule fast-forwarded to c83dda0 (21 files, 4518 insertions)
- EI-4: Pass — submodule pointer committed at 73f69cf
- EI-5: Pass — integration verification with VR CR-092-VR-001
- EI-6: Pass — post-execution at 5fdbf9b
VERIFIED.

2. BLOCKING VARs: None created. N/A. VERIFIED.

3. VR-FLAGGED EIs HAVE ATTACHED VRs WITH COMPLETE EVIDENCE:
EI-5 flagged "Yes" in VR column, replaced with CR-092-VR-001.
CR-092-VR-001 status: IN_EXECUTION v1.0, checked in (not checked out). Ready for review.

VR content verified against SOP-004 Section 9C.4-9C.5:
- Section 1 (Identification): Parent CR-092, EI-5, date 2026-02-21. PRESENT.
- Section 2 (Objective): Clearly stated. PRESENT.
- Section 3 (Pre-Conditions): System state documented (main at 73f69cf, submodule at c83dda0, Windows 11, Python 3.12). PRESENT.
- Section 4 (Steps): Three verification steps, each with action/expected/actual/outcome:
  Step 1: "python qms-cli/qms.py --user claude interact --help" — full help output with all expected flags. Pass. Commit 77c1e50 pinned.
  Step 2: "git -C qms-cli log --oneline | grep 7e708fc" — output shows "7e708fc Add qualification tests..." Exit code 0. Pass. Commit 3a68f99 pinned.
  Step 3: "git submodule status qms-cli" — shows c83dda08dbf... No '+' prefix. Pass. Commit fdf95b2 pinned.
- Section 5 (Summary): Overall Pass with narrative. PRESENT.
- Section 6 (Signature): claude, 2026-02-21. PRESENT.
- Evidence is observational (copy-pasted command output), contemporaneous (timestamps and commit hashes per response), reproducible (exact commands documented). Meets SOP-004 Section 9C.5. VERIFIED.

4. CONTROLLED DOCUMENTS MODIFIED ARE EFFECTIVE:
No controlled documents modified by CR-092 (scope lists only INV-012 as "Reference"). N/A. VERIFIED.

5. REVISION_SUMMARY REQUIREMENTS:
No documents modified. N/A. VERIFIED.

6. FOR CODE CRs: RS AND RTM EFFECTIVE:
CR-092 does not modify code (propagates existing commits, updates submodule pointer). Not a code modification CR requiring RS/RTM updates. N/A. VERIFIED.

7. FOR CODE CRs AFFECTING SUBMODULE-BASED SYSTEMS: QUALIFIED COMMIT REACHABLE (NEW — SOP-002 v14.0):
CR-092 updates the qms-cli submodule pointer. VR CR-092-VR-001 provides direct evidence:
- Step 2: qualified commit 7e708fc reachable from production main (grep exit code 0)
- Step 3: submodule pointer at c83dda0 committed (no '+' prefix)
VERIFIED.

EXECUTION COMMENTS REVIEW:
- EI-2 deviation documented: origin was already at c83dda0; push was unnecessary. Gap was limited to pipe-dream submodule pointer. Appropriately documented.
- Bug fix documented: checkin.py:71 dead parameter removed (pre-existing CR-091 defect). Transparently documented. Minor incidental fix, not a failed EI.

EXECUTION SUMMARY: Present, narratively summarizes outcomes and EI-2 deviation. VERIFIED.

FINDING: COMPLIANT. All post-review requirements met. Recommend proceeding to post-approval.
